content: Singaporean scientist **Patricia Mian Lon Ng** is a Singaporean scientist. She is a researcher at the [Singapore Immunology Network](/wiki/Singapore_Immunology_Network). ## Biography Ng holds a [Ph.D.](/wiki/Doctor_of_Philosophy) degree in cell and molecular biology. She is a research fellow at the Singapore Immunology Network, part of the [Agency for Science, Technology and Research](/wiki/Agency_for_Science,_Technology_and_Research) in Singapore. Ng's research focuses on re-engineering antibodies so that they become more effective in fighting disease. In 2012 she received a [L'Or√©al-UNESCO For Women in Science Award](/wiki/L%27Or%C3%A9al-UNESCO_For_Women_in_Science_Awards). She was also nominated for a Great Women of Our Time Award, an annual suite of awards by *The Singapore Women's Weekly* magazine. This article about a Singaporean scientist is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Patricia Miang Lon Ng
